noun
- a period of opportunity
= example: a period of opportunity
- some point or period in time
= example: some point or period in time
- the recurring hours when you are not sleeping, especially those when you are working
= example: the recurring hours when you are not sleeping, especially those when you are working
- time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis
= example: time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis
= synonyms: twenty-four hours, twenty-four hour period, solar day, mean solar day
- a day assigned to a particular purpose or observance
- the time after sunrise and before sunset while it is light outside
= example: the time after sunrise and before sunset while it is light outside
= synonyms: daylight
- the time for one complete rotation of the earth relative to a particular star, about 4 minutes shorter than a mean solar day
= synonyms: sidereal day
- the period of time taken by a particular planet (e.g. Mars) to make a complete rotation on its axis
= example: the period of time taken by a particular planet (e.g. Mars) to make a complete rotation on its axis
- an era of existence or influence
= example: an era of existence or influence
